title: Design for Textile
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
medium: Felt tip marker and graphite on white wove paper
description: Two separate designs on one sheet horizontally positions. The upper design shows intricate pattern of squares and triangles linked by open work triangles, diamonds and rectangles.  The lower design consists of thick horizontal lines inteeeersected with diamonds, ovals, triangles and parabolic shapes.
name: Drawing
